description:
## Quarkus

This dashboard lets you monitor your applications developed with the Quarkus framework.

**Note: This dashboard only displays out of the box metrics. Tweak it as you add more metrics to your application.**

## Useful Links
- [Quarkus Homepage](https://quarkus.io/)
- [How to add metrics in Quarkus](https://quarkus.io/guides/telemetry-micrometer-tutorial#inject-the-meterregistry)
title: Quarkus Overview

definition.content:
## Quarkus

This dashboard lets you monitor your applications developed with the Quarkus framework.

**Note: This dashboard only displays out of the box metrics. Tweak it as you add more metrics to your application.**

## Useful Links
- [Quarkus Homepage](https://quarkus.io/)
- [How to add metrics in Quarkus](https://quarkus.io/guides/telemetry-micrometer-tutorial#inject-the-meterregistry)

See the overall status of your application. The health service check reports whether or not your application is up. The monitor alerts you if the maximum duration for a request exceeds a certain threshold.
Inspect the HTTP server that powers your app. See how long requests are taking and which ones take the longest.
See how your app's worker pool is handling the load. How many tasks are still pending? How many workers are active or idle?

Netty is the Input/Output framework that powers the HTTP server that powers your app.
Here you can see how many tasks Netty's executor component has. You can also see how much memory the allocator component is using.
Drill down into Java Virtual Machine's resource usage and threads.
Compare your application's CPU usage to the system's. See how many files your application has open.
